data.name: MS_GRAPH_QUICK_START
data.value: Microsoft Graph Quick Start

data.name: MS_GRAPH_QUICK_START_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This quick start will let you try out calls, register your app, and download a sample app that connects to data using Microsoft Graph. The sample app sends an email on a user's behalf. It will show you how to authenticate and make calls to Microsoft Graph using a school or work or a Microsoft account.

data.name: ON_ERROR
data.value:
Something weird has happened

Please try again

data.name: PICK_PLATFORM_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Build a simple app that connects to Office 365 and calls the Microsoft Graph API. After you pick your platform, you'll walk through getting the right tools, registering your app, and running the code.

data.name: PICK_PLATFORM_NOTE
data.value: Note: You can not change the platform once an app has been registered. To change the platform, please click here to start over.

data.name: PICK_PLATFORM_TITLE
data.value: Pick the platform you'll be building for

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_ANDROID
data.value: If you haven't already, install Android Studio.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_ANGULAR
data.value: If you haven't already, install Node.js and Bower.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_DOTNET
data.value: If you haven't already, install Visual Studio 2015 Community or Enterprise.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_IOS
data.value:
• 1. If you haven't already, download and install Xcode on your Mac.
  • 2. Run the following commands to install and set up the CocoaPods dependency manager.
    sudo gem install cocoapods
    pod setup

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_IOS_OBJECTIVE_C
data.value:
• 1. Download and install Xcode on your Mac. You can find it here.
  • 2. Run the following commands to install and set up the CocoaPods dependency manager.
    sudo gem install cocoapods
    pod setup

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_IOS_SWIFT
data.value:
• 1. Download and install Xcode 7.3.1 on your Mac. You can find it here.

    Note: The sample was tested on Xcode 7.3.1. This sample does not yet support XCode 8 and iOS10, which uses the Swift 3.0 framework.

  • 2. Run the following commands to install and set up the CocoaPods dependency manager.
    sudo gem install cocoapods
    pod setup

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_JAVASCRIPT
data.value: 1. Get your favorite text editor. You can write JavaScript in many different IDEs and since none provide a significant advantage for developing with the Office 365 APIs, choose your favorite and get started. [Brackets](http://brackets.io/), [Sublime Text](http://www.sublimetext.com/), [WebStorm](https://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm/), and [Visual Studio](http://www.visualstudio.com/downloads) are popular choices.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_NODEJS
data.value: • Download and install Node.js and npm.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_PHP
data.value: If you haven't already, download and install PHP version 5.6.0 or later.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_PYTHON
data.value:
If you haven't already, you need to download and install the following tools:

  • - Python 3.4.2.
  • - Django 1.7.1.

Be sure you can run a localhost web server before continuing.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_RUBY
data.value: If you haven’t already, download and install Ruby on Rails. Be sure you can run a localhost web server before continuing.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_UWP
data.value:
To get set up:

  • 1. Install Visual Studio 2015 Community or Enterprise.
  • 2. Verify Windows 10 development mode is enabled.
  • 3. Make sure that you've installed the tools for Windows 10 development.

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_DESCRIPTION_XAMARIN
data.value:
To get set up:

  • 1. Install Visual Studio 2015 Community or Enterprise.
  • 2. Install Xamarin for Visual Studio.
  • 3. Verify Windows 10 development mode is enabled.
  • 4. Make sure that you've installed the tools for Windows 10 development.

data.value: Get set up for Android development

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_TITLE_ANGULAR
data.value: Get set up for Angular development

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_TITLE_DOTNET
data.value: Get set up for ASP.NET MVC development

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_TITLE_IOS
data.value: Get set up for iOS development

data.value: # Before you begin

data.name: PLATFORM_SETUP_TITLE_NODEJS
data.value: Get set up for Node.js development

data.value: Get set up for PHP development

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running: Unzip downloaded package, open solution, and run.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_ANDROID
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running: Unzip downloaded package, open solution, and run.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_ANGULAR
data.value:
Almost there! To run the code sample:
  • 1. Unzip the downloaded package to a folder, and go to that folder in your command-line tool.
  • 2. Run npm install and bower install hello to install project dependencies.
  • 3.Run npm start and go to http://localhost:8080/ in your web browser.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_DOTNET
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running: Unzip downloaded package, open solution, and run.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_IOS_OBJECTIVE_C
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running:
  • 1. Unzip the downloaded package.
  • 2. Navigate to the swift or objective-c project folder.
  • 3. Run pod install.
  • 4. Open the workspace in Xcode and run.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_IOS_SWIFT
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running:
  • 1. Unzip the downloaded package.
  • 2. Navigate to the swift or objective-c project folder.
  • 3. Run pod install.
  • 4. Open the workspace in Xcode and run.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_JAVASCRIPT
data.value: Thanks! Your project is on its way from GitHub. To continue: Unzip downloaded package and run.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_NODE
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running: Unzip downloaded package, change directory to the project and run:
  •     npm install
  •     npm start
Then open your browser to the specified port (i.e. http://localhost:3000).

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_PHP
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running: Unzip downloaded package. Run the command composer install to install the required dependencies and php –S 0.0.0.0:8000 –t app to start the web server. Access the app at http://localhost:8000.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_PYTHON
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running:
  • 1. Unzip downloaded package, navigate to the folder.
  • 2. Install the Requests: HTTP for Humans library by running pip install requests.
  • 3. Run python manage.py migrate to initialize the database for the app.
  • 4. Then run python manage.py runserver to start your server.
  • 5. Go to http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your web browser.

data.name: POST_DOWNLOAD_INSTRUCTION_RUBY
data.value:
Almost there! To get it running:

  • 1. Unzip downloaded package and go to the folder.
  • 2. If you don't already have bundler and rack, you can install them with the following command:
        gem install bundler rack.
  • 3. Install the Rails application and dependencies with the following command:
        bundle install
  • 4. To start the Rails application, type the following command:
        rackup -p 3000
  • 5. Go to http://localhost:3000 in your web browser.

To see how this sample was created, please see our getting started walkthrough.

data.name: REGISTER_APP_DESCRIPTION
data.value: To register your app, we will take you to the Microsoft Application Registration portal where you will be able to get an App ID and redirect URL. You will need either a school or work or Microsoft account.

data.name: REGISTER_APP_DESCRIPTION_MOBILE
data.value:
To register your app, we will take you to the Microsoft Application Registration portal where you will be able to get an App ID and redirect URL. You will need either a school or work or Microsoft account.
This sample app will work for most users*.

data.name: REGISTER_APP_NOTE_MOBILE
data.value: *Building an app for enterprise users only? Use Azure Active Directory V1. Here is why. Get Started with this code sample.

data.name: REGISTER_APP_SECRET_PROMPT
data.value: Please re-enter the App Secret that you generated and saved:

data.name: REGISTER_APP_SUCCESS_MSG
data.value: Thanks for registering your app. By the way, we also set the Redirect URI on your behalf so it can work with our code sample.

data.name: REGISTER_APP_SUCCESS_TITLE
data.value: Registration Successful!

data.name: REGISTER_APP_TITLE
data.value: Register the sample app

data.name: TRY_OUT_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Pick an API, try different values, and choose the Try button to see the responses from a sample tenant.

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_CONTACTS_LABEL
data.value: Get all contacts

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_EVENTS_LABEL
data.value: Get events

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_FILES_LABEL
data.value: Get files

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_FILES_NOTES_TEXT
data.value: Path of the files.

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_GROUPS_LABEL
data.value: Get groups

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_GROUPS_NOTES_TEXT
data.value: Groups and query strings of group profile

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_MESSAGES_NOTES_TEXT
data.value: The target folder ID or well-known name: Inbox, SentItems, Drafts, or DeletedItems.

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_MESSAGE_LABEL
data.value: Get messages

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_USERS_LABEL
data.value: Get users

data.name: TRY_OUT_GET_USERS_NOTES_TEXT
data.value: User(s) and query strings of user(s) profile.

data.name: TRY_OUT_RESONSE_BODY
data.value: Response Body

data.value: Name

data.name: TRY_OUT_TABLE_HEADER_NOTES
data.value: Notes

data.name: TRY_OUT_TABLE_HEADER_TYPE
data.value: Type

data.name: TRY_OUT_TABLE_HEADER_VALUE
data.value: Value

data.name: TRY_OUT_TITLE
data.value: Try it out

data.name: TRY_OUT_TRY_LABEL
data.value: Try
